title: Kawasaki Disease E-Learning Resource Development and Evaluation: Instructional Design Based on Multimedia Design Principles

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge of pediatrics and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: E-learning resource development and evaluation course focusing on Kawasaki disease diagnosis/therapy protocol review for practicing professionals, providing VR/simulation-based interactive learning in BYOD environments

learning_goals: Accurately explain the etiology, diagnostic criteria, differential diagnosis, and treatment guidelines for Kawasaki disease.
Perform an e-learning resource development process applying the 12 Principles of Multimedia Design.
Analyze the usability (navigation, visual design, learning motivation) of e-learning resources and propose improvements using VR/simulation-based assessment tools.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
